abstract.p: Michael Webb is author of book Architecture & Design LA: Selective Guide to the Best Buildings, Interiors, Design Resources and Art Facilities in Southern California; photo (Currents column) (S)

block.p: Ever wondered where interior designers and the house-proud in Los Angeles shop? At boutiques on La Brea and Beverly Boulevards and on Melrose Avenue (Skank World and Modernica, to name two), in the workrooms of furniture designers like Gregg Fleishman (above, outside his studio in Culver City) and at flea markets. That's the latest from Michael Webb, author of ''Architecture & Design LA'' (The Understanding Business, $14), whose third edition is subtitled ''Selective Guide to the Best Buildings, Interiors, Design Resources and Arts Facilities in Southern California.'' What is ''out,'' Mr. Webb? Most showrooms at the Pacific Design Center (though Knoll, Snaidero and Dakota Jackson make the cut) and chain stores like Ikea. The 88-page guidebook's design and building supplies source list is a useful addition to an opinionated tour of the best architecture in Los Angeles; (510) 649-3730.
